result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick A Haapala was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution and to be held open for 60 days to determine if there is a request for restitution and determine amount.

$500.00 Cash bond on deposit to be applied to the Court costs after Atty Barkley submits his bill.  Pay court costs to include the domestic abuse surcharge. 
  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not have and violent or abusive contact with the following persons/places:  Lynette Asher
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
After 6 months if successfully completes probation early discharge from probation if all conditions are satisfied and probation officer approves the early discharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick A Haapala

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation
Copy of Check from Golden County Foods - $100
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Derrick A Haapala in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. David Knaapen appears on behalf of Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:35 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
State moves to amend charge in criminal complaint to a disorderly conduct which would be a Class B Misdemeanor.
Atty Knaapen states his recommendations on the record.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No Contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not make a statement prior to his sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 12 months.
Pay restitution and to be held open for 60 days to determine if there is a request for restitution and determine amount.
Cash bond on deposit to be applied to the Court costs after Atty Barkley submits his bill.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not have and violent or abusive contact with the following persons/places:  Lynette Asher
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Pay court costs to include the domestic abuse surcharge
After 6 months if successfully completes probation early discharge from probation if all conditions are satisfied and probation officer approves the early discharge.
1 day credit for jail
Costs to be paid within 60 days from today's date
for Attorney to Appear and Act - Atty Barkley
for Attorney fees at $100 per pay period
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Atty Barkley appointed - reinbursement at $100 per pay period
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick A Haapala in court. 
10:34 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
Clerk swears in the Mr. Haapala.
Court questions Mr. Haapala re: his Petition for Appointment of Counsel. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds the defendant is partially indigent. 
Repay at $100 per paycheck by wage assignment. 

Atty Jerod Barkley is in Court.  
Defendant makes statements. 
Atty Barkley is present and accepts the appointment. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.

No abusive or violent contact with Lynette Asher. 
Cash previously posted.

Defendant Derrick A Haapala in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant indicates he did not qualify for a Public Defender.  He has the petition for appointment of counsel. 
Court advises defendant to take that petition to Br 2. 

NOT GUILTY plea entered by the Court on the defendant's behalf. 

Atty Knaapen recommends the  with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.
